page.title: 15A PENICUIK TRAFFIC CONCERN
page.content: One of the controversial issues in our area at the moment is the barrier at the bottom of Mauricewood Road. This barrier was erected to protect children going to Mauricewood Primary and Beeslack Secondary School. It runs along both sides of the busy Edinburgh to Penicuik road. The problem arises when the barrier turns the corner at each side of Mauricewood Road. Drivers coming out of the road can't see because the barrier blocks their view of oncoming traffic. The height of the barrier has already been lowered but it is still causing an obstruction. At the bottom of Mauricewood Road there is a bus stop and people coming from Edinburgh can't cross onto the opposite pavement because the barrier goes all the way round the corner. These people have to walk on the busy road.
